# Issue
In Zitadel versions prior to 2.63.4, disabling the user self-registration feature only hides the registration button on the login page without fully preventing access to the registration URL (/ui/login/loginname). This allows users to bypass the intended restriction.

# Impact
Unauthorized users can register even when user registration is disabled, leading to potential unauthorized access and increased risk to system security.

# Proposed Solution

Backend Check for User Registration Setting
Modify the backend endpoint handling registration requests (at /ui/login/loginname) to include a validation check that ensures user registration is indeed enabled in the system settings.

go
```go
func RegisterUserHandler(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    if !settings.IsUserRegistrationAllowed() {
        http.Error(w, "User registration is disabled", http.StatusForbidden)
        return
    }
    // Proceed with registration logic
}
```

# Alerts 

Groups
```
groups:
  - name: FailedRegistrationAlert
    rules:
      - alert: HighFailedRegistrationAttempts
        expr: rate(failed_registration_attempts_total[5m]) > 10
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: "critical"
        annotations:
          summary: "High number of failed registration attempts detected"
          description: "There have been more than 10 failed registration attempts in the last 5 minutes."
```

# Add Audit Logs

Include logging for any unauthorized registration attempts when registration is disabled. This can help admins monitor suspicious activity.

Summary

- Backend Check: Restricts registration via backend logic.
- Frontend Feedback: Alerts users and redirects them if registration is disabled.
- Logging: Logs unauthorized registration attempts.
- Monitoring Alerts: Sets up Prometheus and Alertmanager to notify admins of repeated attempts.
